summary: A ternary-conditional-expression conditionally chooses one of two values.
details: The left expression is only evaluated, if the condition produces true.
The right expression is only evaluated, if the condition produces false.
The condition will be unboxed, if necessary.
Return either the value of left or the value of right, depending on the value produced by the condition.
static-checks: The type of condition must be assignable to type boolean.
The type of the left must be either a primitive-type or a reference-type.
The type of the right must be either a primitive-type or a reference-type.
The type of one of the operands must be a subtype of the other.
